newsitem.title: USA: Koppers Industries delays IPO again.
newsitem.headline: Koppers Industries delays IPO again.

text.p: Koppers Industries Inc on Wednesday said in a statement that it again delayed its planned $112 million initial public stock offering.
The company filed in May 1996 to offer seven million shares in a price range of $15 to $17. It first announced a delay in July 1996.
Company spokesman Don Travis said the issue of whether to proceed with the offering "had been on the back burner for about three months."

The company's investment bankers told Koppers officials "market conditions right now do not make it the best of timing" to proceed with the offering, Travis said when asked why the IPO was being delayed again.
Travis said the company still intended to proceed with an offering at a later date.
Koppers produces specialty carbon compounds and chemically treated wood products for use in the chemical, railroad, aluminum and steel industries.
